Dear Ms. Zambiasi:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & R 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section Rule 158. (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow
Description written policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth
on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/10/23, there was a physical altercation between Youth A and
a staff member. Youth A attempted to obtain keys from staff
member and staff member pinned youth's shoulders to the wall
and appeared to strike youth in the head. Youth A has a bruise on
the left side of their face.
Investigation This complaint was received on 03/13/2023 and investigated in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist.
I interviewed the complainant via telephone on 03/13/2023 and
they reported no further information.
I interviewed Youth A’s Foster Care Specialist via telephone on
03/13/2023. She reported Youth A has been at the facility for one
year and has completed the program but is awaiting placement in
an ILS program. Youth A is reportedly getting anxious and wants
to be placed in an ILS program. Foster Care Specialist said prior
to this incident she had not had any concerns regarding staff or
the facility.
I interviewed Consumer Rights Officer at the facility on
03/13/2023, in collaboration with DHHS Specialist. He reported
there is video footage of the incident that occurred on 03/10/2023.
Staff 1 has been put on administrative leave pending the
investigation. He said Staff 1 has only been working at the facility
for 6 weeks and has most of his training including CPI.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 03/13/2023, in collaboration
with DHHS Specialist. Youth A was observed to have a small
bruise on her upper left cheek. No other injuries were observed or
reported. Youth A has been at the facility for one year and has
completed the program. Youth A reported on 03/10/2023 she was
upset at another youth that is not on her wing and she was trying
to get to that youth and fight her. She admitted to grabbing Staff
2

1’s keys to open the door and that’s when Staff 1 hit her in the
face with his hand and pushed her against the wall. She said Staff
2 and 3 intervened and Youth B helped by hitting Staff 1. Youth A
said she was very angry and upset and was trying to hit Staff 1
and he threatened to punch her. She said Supervisor 1 came on
the wing and escorted Staff 1 off the wing. She said the police
were called to the facility and she requested to speak to police,
but staff would not allow her to speak to the police. Youth A said
she wants to file charges against Staff 1. Youth A said Staff 1 has
never worked on her unit and that was her first interaction with
Staff 1.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility on 03/13/2023, in collaboration
with DHHS Specialist. Youth B has been at the facility for 9
months and is on the purple wing with Youth A. Youth A reported
on the day of the incident she was in the shower and heard Youth
A yelling, so she came out of the bathroom. She saw Staff 1 come
in through the back door of the wing. Staff 1 asked if staff needed
help and Staff 2 told him they did not need help. Youth B said
Youth A attempted to grab Staff 1’s keys and Staff 1 slammed
Youth A against the wall and hit her in the face. Youth B said
Youth A is “her girl” and she had to protect her, so she hit Staff 1
several times in the head. Youth B said Staff 1 was looking at her
and Youth A in a weird way and that gave them a weird vibe about
him. She admitted to hitting and throwing a water bottle at Staff 1.
Youth B said Staff 2 and 3 intervened and blocked her from hitting
Staff 1.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the facility on 03/13/2023, in collaboration
with DHHS Specialist. Staff 1 reported he has been working at the
facility for 6 weeks and has completed most of his training. On the
day of the incident, he was told to go and assist staff on the purple
wing. When he got to the purple wing, he saw Youth A standing at
the door banging on the glass, so he walked toward the door
holding his keys. Youth A immediately reached for his keys, so he
put his hands up trying to stop her from grabbing his keys. He told
Youth A to back away and she did back away, but that’s when he
was hit in the back of his head, eye, and face. His glasses fell and
he felt disoriented, so he leaned against the wall. He said
Supervisor 1 came and helped him walk off the wing. The two
youths threw something at him, and it hit him in the shoulder. He
denied punching or hitting Youth A. Staff 1 said he felt disoriented
and was trying to find his glasses during the incident. Staff 1 said
he didn’t know how he should have responded in the situation and
asked consultant and DHHS Specialist how should he have
handled the situation.
3

I interviewed Staff 2 at the facility on 03/13/2023, in collaboration
with DHHS Specialist. Staff 2 has been working at the facility for
over one year. She reported on 03/10/2023 Staff 1 came to the
unit asking if they needed assistance and she responded they did
not need help. She said Staff 1 went to open the door that Youth A
was trying to open and that’s when Youth A attempted to grab
Staff 1’s keys. She said Staff 1 put his hands up and cornered
Youth A while trying to release her hold on the keys. She
intervened and got herself in between Staff 1 and Youth A. She
didn’t see Staff 1 hit Youth A but thinks he may have during the
incident. She said Youth B did hit Staff 1 several times in the head
and face. She had to tell Staff 1 to leave the unit several times
before the Supervisor came and escorted him off the unit.
I interviewed Staff 3 at the facility on 03/13/2023, in collaboration
with DHHS Specialist. Staff 3 reported that Staff 1 came on to the
wing due to “clear” call from another wing, so Staff 2 told him they
don’t need any assistance. She saw Youth A attempt to grab Staff
1’s keys and that’s Staff 1 put his hands up, so Staff 3 intervened
and attempted to free Youth A’s hands off the keys. She did not
see Staff 1 punch or hit Youth A, but Youth B punched Staff 1
several times in the head and face.
I interviewed Supervisor 1 via telephone on 03/13/2023, in
collaboration with DHHS Specialist. Supervisor 1 reported on
03/10/2023 the police were contacted regarding another incident
and so she did not witness the incident involving Youth A and
Staff 1. She came on the unit to assist and escorted Staff 1 off the
unit. Staff 1 was not angry or aggressive but was more disoriented
and confused. She was informed by staff that Staff 1 was hit in the
head several times.
I received an email from Consumer Rights Officer on 03/27/2023
indicated that Staff 1’s employment has been terminated with the
facility.
On 04/04/2023 a Predisposition case conference held with DHHS
Specialist and managers. No findings.
Video Reviewed:
The video has no audio. Youth A and Youth B are observed
standing at the door and appear to be upset. There are two staff
members on the unit, and Staff 1 enters the unit through the back
door. He walks toward the two youths. Youth A turns around and
attempts to grab Staff 1’s keys. Staff 1 attempts to grab the keys
4

back and puts his hands up. Staff 2 attempts to get in between
Youth A and Staff 1 as they are standing in the corner of the room,
and that’s when Youth B comes from behind Staff 1 hits him in the
head three times and twice in the face. Staff 3 pulls Youth B away
from Staff 1. Staff 1 appears to be disoriented, he is seen leaning
against the wall with has his hand on his head. Youth A throws her
shoe at Staff 1, and Youth 2 throws a water bottle at Staff 1.
Supervisor escorts Staff 1 off the unit while Staff 2 and 3 block
Youth A and B from assaulting Staff 1. At no point in the video
does Staff 1 appear to hit or punch Youth A. Youth A is seen
speaking to a police officer after the incident for several minutes.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 03/10/2023, written by Staff 2,
occurred on purple wing in the living room area. Report is
consistent with Staff 2’s interview.
• Staff 1 training logs: Staff 1 completed CPI training on
02/08/23 and 02/09/23. On 03/03/2023 Staff 1 had 84.5
training hours completed.
• Youth A’s medical exam completed at Henry Ford Health
on 03/11/2023. There was no head injury or swelling. Youth
A had a bruise on her left upper cheek.
Analysis The facility is compliant with the rule as there is insufficient
evidence to determine that the staff hit the youth during the
incident. Youth A did sustain a bruise on her face, but because
there were three staff members and two youths involved it could
not be determined how Youth got the bruise. Staff 1 denied hitting
or punching Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (b) Experience to perform the duties of the position assigned.
Violation Additional Findings
Type
Allegation Staff 1 did not have the experience to perform the duties of the
position.
Investigation See content above.
Staff 1 said he didn’t know how he should have responded in the
situation and asked consultant and DHHS Specialist how should
he have handled the situation.
5

Analysis The facility is in violation based on video footage that shows that
Staff 1 and Youth A engaged in a power struggle over the Staff’s
keys. Staff 1 asked consultant and DHHS Specialist how should
he have handled the situation, which points to staff lack of
experience/training. Staff 1 has only worked at the facility for 6
weeks, has not completed all his training, and lacks the
experience to perform the duties of his assigned position.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
